definition: beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]

sentences.english: I just bought a new Toyota Camry for $19,000.
sentences.chinese: 我剛剛花一萬九千美元買了輛豐田佳美車。

sentences.english: Let us get up early to the vineyards;
sentences.chinese: 風茄放香，在我們的門內有各樣新陳佳美的果子。

sentences.english: Can Carmenere from Chile compete with The Best Red Wines of the World?
sentences.chinese: 智利佳美娜能否匹敵世界最佳紅葡萄酒？

sentences.english: But kick the door home as if all blow and comfortable new haven't given zhao jiamei face.
sentences.chinese: 但踢門回家的酣暢和舒新彷彿都沒給趙佳美面子。
啊哈，那輛豐田佳美去了哪裏呢？

sentences.english: Carmenere grapes make this wine showed dark red purple.
sentences.chinese: 佳美娜葡萄使得這款酒呈現深紅紫色。

sentences.english: The thin heads of grain swallowed up the seven good heads.
sentences.chinese: 這些細弱的穗子吞了那七個佳美的穗子。

sentences.english: Today, Carmenere becomes the symbolic grape variety in Chile.
sentences.chinese: 如今，佳美娜更是成爲智利的代表性紅葡萄品種。

sentences.english: The mountains were covered with its shade, the mighty cedars with its branches.
sentences.chinese: 他的影子遮滿了山，枝子好像佳美的香柏樹。

sentences.english: The hills were covered with the shadow of it, and the boughs thereof were like the goodly cedars.
sentences.chinese: 他的影子遮滿了山，枝子好像佳美的香柏樹。

sentences.english: I have cut down its tallest cedars, the choicest of its pines.
sentences.chinese: 我要砍伐其中高大的香柏樹和佳美的松樹。

definition: full up/classifier for items of clothing (old)
to warn/to admonish/variant of 針|针[zhen1]
to describe sth as/an analogy/a simile/a metaphor/an allegory
to arrive/to reach (esp. perfection)/utmost/(used in commercials)
